The anisotropic large strain elasticity &properties; specify that the depends nonlinearly on the gradients of the , \(u\):
\[ \sigma_{ij} = C_{ijkl}\epsilon_{kl} \]
where \(\sigma_{ij}\) is the , \(C_{ijkl}\) is the modulus cijkl, and
\[ \epsilon_{ij} = \frac12\left( \frac{\partial u_i}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial u_j}{\partial x_i} + \frac{\partial u_k}{\partial x_i}\frac{\partial u_k}{\partial x_j} \right). \]
This form of the geometric strain is invariant under rigid rotations, unlike its linear variant, Eq. .
The crystal symmetry of the material is reflected in the symmetry of the modulus, cijkl. &materials; containing an anisotropic elastic &property; must also contain an orientation property.
